description: The upper part of the human body containing the brain, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
The organ of sight in humans and animals.
The organ of hearing and balance in humans and other vertebrates.
The part projecting above the mouth on the face, used for breathing and smelling.
The opening in the face used for speaking, eating, and breathing.
A hard, calcified structure found in the jaws used for breaking down food.
The muscular organ in the mouth used for tasting, swallowing, and speaking.
The part of the body that connects the head to the rest of the body.
The joint connecting the arm with the torso.
The upper limb of the human body from the shoulder to the hand.
The joint between the upper arm and the forearm.
The joint connecting the hand with the forearm.
The end part of the arm beyond the wrist, including the fingers and thumb.
Any of the four slender jointed parts attached to either hand.
The short, thick first digit of the human hand.
The front surface of a person's body between the neck and the abdomen.
The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.
The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs.
The part of the body containing the digestive organs.
The projecting part of each side of the body formed by the side of the pelvis.
Each of the limbs on which a person walks and stands.
The joint between the thigh and the lower leg.
The joint connecting the foot with the leg.
The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands.
Any of the five digits at the end of the human foot.
The organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system.
Each of the pair of organs in the chest involved in breathing.
A large organ that cleans the blood and produces bile.
Each of a pair of organs that excrete urine.
The organ inside the head that controls thought, memory, and feeling.
The thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body.
A band of fibrous tissue that has the ability to contract.
Any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue making up the skeleton.
The red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins.
A vessel carrying blood to the heart.
A vessel carrying blood away from the heart.
A whitish fiber that transmits impulses of sensation to the brain.
The series of vertebrae extending from the skull to the small of the back.
Each of a series of slender curved bones articulated to the spine.
The bony framework of the head enclosing the brain.
